meanings.definition: Workers hired for a single day's work.
meanings.sent1: The dayworkers arrived early in the morning to start their tasks.
meanings.sent2: The construction site always had a team of dayworkers ready to help.
meanings.sent3: The dayworkers joked about finishing their job before the sun sets.
meanings.sent4: The dayworkers were like temporary rays of sunlight brightening the workplace.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dayworkers diligently working under the clear sky stayed with me.

meanings.definition: A group of laborers hired on a daily basis.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, the dayworkers gathered at the market hoping for work.
meanings.sent2: The farm relied on a group of dayworkers to assist with the harvest.
meanings.sent3: The dayworkers shared stories during their lunch break, creating a sense of community.
meanings.sent4: The dayworkers were the heartbeat of the construction site, keeping it alive and bustling.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the dayworkers toiling away in unison painted a picture of unity and hard work.
